sense.name: cover with glass, glaze
sense.examples: She also glassed the window next to the front door. I removed the rear-view mirror, and carefully glassed the window.

sense.name: scan with binoculars
sense.examples: They have to keep on the move,' she said as she glassed the slopes... She glassed the country for the black of a moose. When it was light enough to use binoculars he glassed the valley below.

sense.name: enclose with glass
sense.examples: We glassed in the porch to make a small conservatory. I have glassed in the porch area and modernized the electrical systems. The couple glassed in the partially open walls in the master bedroom.

sense.name: put in a glass, glass container
become glassy, glass-like in appearance
sense.examples: She glassed over in a drugged haze. My clown fish's eye has glassed over. My rage was such that my eyes simply glassed over.

sense.name: strike or cut someone with glass
sense.examples: Ray was glassed in the face by a thug at a nightclub. He had previously been glassed in the face with a beer jug. She was allegedly glassed in the back of the head. A security guard was glassed in the face by a male in Northbridge.
